main event: Observers in Nogales, Arizona reported seeing a light circling in the sky on 21 August 1949, believed to be related to airport beacon lights.
interesting points: The light was first observed at the apex of a cone of light originating from Nogales Airport., Reports from multiple witnesses described the object as a dull white light moving in a circular pattern., Witnesses had varying accounts of the object's shape and color, some describing it as blue-white and others as orange., The time of observation was reported to be from approximately 2115 to 2335 hours., Sightings on 14 and 20 August were evaluated as meteors according to the report.
sighted object: a circling light in the sky
witness description: Residents, including various families and a Sheriff, reported seeing the light and described it differently, with accounts of irregular motion and other characteristics.
